title: A train running at the speed of 60 km/hr crosses a pole in 9 seconds. What is the length of the train?

Two ships are sailing in the sea on the two sides of a lighthouse. The angle of elevation of the top of the lighthouse is observed from the ships are 30° and 45° respectively. If the lighthouse is 100 m high, the distance between the two ships is:
A person crosses a 600 m long street in 5 minutes. What is his speed in km per hour
A sum of money at simple interest amounts to Rs. 815 in 3 years and to Rs. 854 in 4 years. The sum is:
A fruit seller had some apples. He sells 40% apples and still has 420 apples. Originally, he had:
The sum of ages of 5 children born at the intervals of 3 years each is 50 years. What is the age of the youngest child?

The ratio between the length and the breadth of a rectangular park is 3 : 2. If a man cycling along the boundary of the park at the speed of 12 km/hr completes one round in 8 minutes, then the area of the park (in sq. m) is:
3 pumps, working 8 hours a day, can empty a tank in 2 days. How many hours a day must 4 pumps work to empty the tank in 1 day?
In the first 10 overs of a cricket game, the run rate was only 3.2. What should be the run rate in the remaining 40 overs to reach the target of 282 runs?
What least number must be added to 1056, so that the sum is completely divisible by 23 ?
A sum of money is to be distributed among A, B, C, D in the proportion of 5 : 2 : 4 : 3. If C gets Rs. 1000 more than D, what is B's share?
A hall is 15 m long and 12 m broad. If the sum of the areas of the floor and the ceiling is equal to the sum of the areas of four walls, the volume of the hall is:
Running at the same constant rate, 6 identical machines can produce a total of 270 bottles per minute. At this rate, how many bottles could 10 such machines produce in 4 minutes?
An accurate clock shows 8 o'clock in the morning. Through how may degrees will the hour hand rotate when the clock shows 2 o'clock in the afternoon?
66 cubic centimetres of silver is drawn into a wire 1 mm in diameter. The length of the wire in metres will be:
A train running at the speed of 60 km/hr crosses a pole in 9 seconds. What is the length of the train?
